name: AWS SQS server side encryption not enabled
description:
SSE lets you transmit sensitive data in encrypted queues. SSE protects the contents of messages in Amazon SQS queues using keys managed in the AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS). SSE encrypts messages as soon as Amazon SQS receives them. The messages are stored in encrypted form and Amazon SQS decrypts messages only when they are sent to an authorized consumer.

SQS SSE and the AWS KMS security standards can help you meet encryption-related compliance requirements.
searchModel.query: config from cloud.resource where cloud.type = 'aws' AND api.name = 'aws-sqs-get-queue-attributes' AND json.rule = attributes.KmsMasterKeyId does not exist
recommendation:
To remediate this alert, enable Server-Side Encryption (SSE) on your SQS queues.

1. Go to the AWS console SQS dashboard.
2. Check the queue you want to modify.
3. From the Queue Actions pulldown menu, select 'Configure Queue.'
4. Under Server-Side Encryption (SSE) Settings, check 'Use SSE' and Save.
